metadata.title: CVE-2021-47265 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: RDMA:Verify port when creating flow rule Validate port value provided by theuser and with that remove no longer needed validation by the driver. Themissing check in the mlx5_ib driver could cause to the below oops. Calltrace: _create_flow_rule+0x2d4/0xf28 [mlx5_ib]mlx5_ib_create_flow+0x2d0/0x5b0 [mlx5_ib]ib_uverbs_ex_create_flow+0x4cc/0x624 [ib_uverbs]ib_uverbs_handler_UVERBS_METHOD_INVOKE_WRITE+0xd4/0x150 [ib_uverbs]ib_uverbs_cmd_verbs.isra.7+0xb28/0xc50 [ib_uverbs]ib_uverbs_ioctl+0x158/0x1d0 [ib_uverbs] do_vfs_ioctl+0xd0/0xaf0ksys_ioctl+0x84/0xb4 __arm64_sys_ioctl+0x28/0xc4el0_svc_common.constprop.3+0xa4/0x254 el0_svc_handler+0x84/0xa0el0_svc+0x10/0x26c Code: b9401260 f9615681 51000400 8b001c20 (f9403c1a)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1003-laptop - 6.5.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1003.6').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
